poem:
### Diplomatic Choreography

Beneath the olive branches, whispers trade  
words like currency, in Moscow's grip.  
Shadowed gazes meet over maps, where dust  
settles on borders and history sleeps.  
A man's name, not the name hoped for,  
echoes through halls; the dance  
of ceasefires and promises,  
rustling like pages, never turned.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Gaza ceasefire live: Israel says body handed over by Hamas is not one of the hostages 2.09pm BST Away from Gaza and Israel, Syria’s interim leader held talks on Wednesday in Russia during his first visit to the country.Welcoming interim president Ahmad al-Sharaa at the Kremlin, Russian president Vladimir Putin praised the historic links between Moscow and Damascus, and he voiced hope for their expansion. The meeting underlines Russia’s desire to establish working ties with". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
